alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 6:02PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hartford County through 700 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Plainville, or near New Britain, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding and pea size hail . SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Manchester, East Hartford, Southington, Glastonbury, Newington, Wethersfield, Farmington, Berlin, Rocky Hill, Avon, Plainville, Burlington, Marlborough and Bolton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
